thread.title: 4,000+ Underprivileged L.A. Children To Receive New Athletic Shoes At Fred Jordan Missions' 27th Annual "Caring For Kids" Back-To-School Giveaway
thread.title_full: 4,000+ Underprivileged L.A. Children To Receive New Athletic Shoes At Fred Jordan Missions' 27th Annual "Caring For Kids" Back-To-School Giveaway - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: 4,000+ Underprivileged L.A. Children To Receive New Athletic Shoes At Fred Jordan Missions' 27th Annual "Caring For Kids" Back-To-School Giveaway
text:
The Fred Jordan Mission
LOS ANGELES , Sept. 30, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --
WHAT:
More than 4,000 impoverished boys and girls will be given free athletic shoes from Foot Locker, new clothing, backpacks filled with school supplies, In-N-Out burgers and Paul Mitchell hair styles.
Throughout the day, children will star in their own "Red Carpet Runway Fashion Show," modeling their new athletic shoes, clothing and backpacks.
In the past 27 years, more than 135,000 children have received new shoes, complete school outfits, school supplies and burgers, at the Mission's Back-to-School event, thanks to the generous partnership of Foot Locker, In-N-Out, Paul Mitchell, Knit Works, and other corporations and individuals.
WHEN:
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 1, 2015
• Children and families start lining up at 6:00am
• Back-To-School Giveaway begins at 9:00am.
Registration is not required.
WHERE:
FRED JORDAN MISSION, 445 Towne Avenue, Los Angeles (corner of Towne and East 5 th Street)
The Fred Jordan Mission , open 365 days a year since 1944, provides nearly 1,000 servings of food each day for hungry families, builds orphanages, schools and hospitals, and distributes food and clothing to people living on the street. The Mission is a non-profit, faith-based, educational and relief organization emphasizing education, job training, and self-reliance.
Foot Locker is part of Foot Locker, Inc and operates more than 3,400 stores in 23 countries in North America , Europe , Australia and New Zealand. Through its Foot Locker, Footaction, Lady Foot Locker , Kids Foot Locker, Champs Sports, SIX:02, Runners Point, and Sidestep retail stores, as well as its direct-to-customer channels, including footlocker.com, Eastbay.com, and , SIX:02.com, the Company is the leading provider of athletic footwear and apparel.
Other sponsors include: In-N-Out Burger, Paul Mitchell Schools , Shelter Partnership; Vera R. Campbell , Knit Works, John Paul Mitchell Hair Care , USC School of Dentistry, Shelter Partnership
Los Angeles , Children's Hunger Fund, Friendship Baptist Church, Edgewood Press , Adrianna Rio and Feed the Children.
